content.description: Starts up a crack near the center of the face then trends up and right at the roof past some bolts.   Shares the same start as Rockin' into the night (10c).  Please see Mike Carville Rock Climbing Lake Tahoe guidebook for additional information.
content.location: Start up the crack near the center of the face

content.description: Starts in a crack near the center of the face to an undercling crack and traverses all the way to the left edge of the face, then up the face past some bolts.  Please see Mike Carville guidebook for additional information.
content.location: Left most route on the main face of Hidetaka's Hideout

content.description: Starts over the right side of the Arete with a surprisingly difficult boulder problem up a block past a bolt on grainy poor quality rock to a good stance and the second bolt.  Here the rock quality improves quite a bit.  A tricky step down and left leads to easier face climbing and some cool knobs past the 3rd bolt.  Try not to fret that you can't see any more bolts.  There is some gear to be had.  I cut out right toward the Arete past a small flake/crack blocked by a very thorny bush that takes a  1 or a 2-inch cam if you tolerate the thorns.  Now go up the blunt Arete climbing over a dubious-looking black semi-detached diorite block that you will end up putting gear behind (finger size cam) out of desperation, but you probably shouldn't.  Think light thoughts and gently ride this thing up to easier terrain and your final bolt.  You can either climb up a cool-looking but contrived pillar past a knob tie-off to the 2-bolt anchors, or you can just skip the difficulties by taking easy 5.5-ish jugs up to the left and traverse back right to the anchor.  Note:  It is not easy to see the anchor on the climb.  It is straight up the pillar/Arete but it is easy to get lured left due to the easier climbing and a visible single bolt high and left.  Do not get lured too high and left by this visible bolt as I did.  This leads you to the top of the cliff, but there are no anchor bolts there and I was faced with a long unprotected down climb/traverse to remedy the situation.
content.protection: 5 bolts, supplemental cams to 2 inches, slings to prevent rope drag, slings for knob tie-offs, 2-bolt top anchor with screw links.
content.location: GPS base of the route:  Lat: 38 50.1568N, Lon: 120 00.6599W

content.description: Starts just left of center of the pillar, shares the same first bolt as Deceptive Pillar but then goes to the right after the first bolt, past 2 more bolts.  Please see Mike Carville guidebook for additional information.
content.protection: Appears to be a mixed route requiring both quickdraws and gear, see guidebook for additional information.
content.location: Deceptive Pillar is to the left of the main face of Hidetaka's hideout.  It is clearly visible from just to the left of "Rockin' into the night" about 100 yards up a gully.

content.description: Goes up the Arete past some bolts on the left side of the same face as Ripper Arete.  Please see Mike Carville Rock Climbing Lake Tahoe guidebook for additional information.
content.protection: Bolts, possibly supplemental gear.  Please see Carville guidebook.
content.location: Left Arete of the same face as Ripper Arete.  There are two separate small gold colored rock formations that make up the main concentration of climbs at Hidetaka's Hideout.  This route goes up the left edge of the right hand formation.  GPS coordinates:  Lat: 38 50.1568N Lon: 120 00.6599W.

climbs.name: Lady Dihedral
climbs.fa: Larry Duin, Rob Bittner, Brock Berry 1997

content.description: Please see Carville, M, Rock Climbing Lake Tahoe guidebook for route information.
content.location: Over to the right of Ripper Arete

climbs.name: Got Your Hammer Hangin'
climbs.fa: Larry Duin, Jay Sell, Bannt Root

content.description: This route appears to go up a short face past one bolt to a slab ledge, then appears to go up a thin crack up and right to a flake/crack near a corner up to an overhang.  Please see Mike Carville Rock Climbing Lake Tahoe guidebook for more information.
content.location: Starts about 15 feet right of the start of Ripper Arete in an alcove.
Please see Mike Carville Rock Climbing Lake Tahoe guidebook.  There are 2 routes on the pillar that share the same start a little left of center of the pillar.  This one goes to the left.
